intro: Torenia benthamiana, commonly known as the common torenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of violet and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are borne on slender stems. Torenia benthamiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and relatively easy care requirements.
